speaker: POLIXENES
text: I pray thee, good Camillo, be no more

speaker: POLIXENES
text: importunate. ’Tis a sickness denying thee anything,

speaker: POLIXENES
text: a death to grant this.

speaker: CAMILLO
text: It is fifteen years since I saw my country.

speaker: CAMILLO
text: Though I have for the most part been aired abroad,

speaker: CAMILLO
text: I desire to lay my bones there. Besides, the penitent

speaker: CAMILLO
text: king, my master, hath sent for me, to whose feeling

speaker: CAMILLO
text: sorrows I might be some allay—or I o’erween to

speaker: CAMILLO
text: think so—which is another spur to my departure.

speaker: POLIXENES
text: As thou lov’st me, Camillo, wipe not out the

speaker: POLIXENES
text: rest of thy services by leaving me now. The need I

speaker: POLIXENES
text: have of thee thine own goodness hath made. Better

speaker: POLIXENES
text: not to have had thee than thus to want thee. Thou,

speaker: POLIXENES
text: having made me businesses which none without

speaker: POLIXENES
text: thee can sufficiently manage, must either stay to

speaker: POLIXENES
text: execute them thyself or take away with thee the very

speaker: POLIXENES
text: services thou hast done, which if I have not enough

speaker: POLIXENES
text: considered, as too much I cannot, to be more

speaker: POLIXENES
text: thankful to thee shall be my study, and my profit

speaker: POLIXENES
text: therein the heaping friendships. Of that fatal country

speaker: POLIXENES
text: Sicilia, prithee speak no more, whose very

speaker: POLIXENES
text: naming punishes me with the remembrance of that

speaker: POLIXENES
text: penitent, as thou call’st him, and reconciled king

speaker: POLIXENES
text: my brother, whose loss of his most precious queen

speaker: POLIXENES
text: and children are even now to be afresh lamented.

speaker: POLIXENES
text: Say to me, when sawst thou the Prince Florizell, my

speaker: POLIXENES
text: son? Kings are no less unhappy, their issue not

speaker: POLIXENES
text: being gracious, than they are in losing them when

speaker: POLIXENES
text: they have approved their virtues.

speaker: CAMILLO
text: Sir, it is three days since I saw the Prince.

speaker: CAMILLO
text: What his happier affairs may be are to me unknown,

speaker: CAMILLO
text: but I have missingly noted he is of late

speaker: CAMILLO
text: much retired from court and is less frequent to his

speaker: CAMILLO
text: princely exercises than formerly he hath appeared.

speaker: POLIXENES
text: I have considered so much, Camillo, and

speaker: POLIXENES
text: with some care, so far that I have eyes under my

speaker: POLIXENES
text: service which look upon his removedness, from

speaker: POLIXENES
text: whom I have this intelligence: that he is seldom

speaker: POLIXENES
text: from the house of a most homely shepherd, a man,

speaker: POLIXENES
text: they say, that from very nothing, and beyond the

speaker: POLIXENES
text: imagination of his neighbors, is grown into an

speaker: POLIXENES
text: unspeakable estate.

speaker: CAMILLO
text: I have heard, sir, of such a man, who hath a

speaker: CAMILLO
text: daughter of most rare note. The report of her is

speaker: CAMILLO
text: extended more than can be thought to begin from

speaker: CAMILLO
text: such a cottage.

speaker: POLIXENES
text: That’s likewise part of my intelligence, but,

speaker: POLIXENES
text: I fear, the angle that plucks our son thither. Thou

speaker: POLIXENES
text: shalt accompany us to the place, where we will, not

speaker: POLIXENES
text: appearing what we are, have some question with

speaker: POLIXENES
text: the shepherd, from whose simplicity I think it not

speaker: POLIXENES
text: uneasy to get the cause of my son’s resort thither.

speaker: POLIXENES
text: Prithee be my present partner in this business, and

speaker: POLIXENES
text: lay aside the thoughts of Sicilia.

speaker: CAMILLO
text: I willingly obey your command.

speaker: POLIXENES
text: My best Camillo. We must disguise

speaker: POLIXENES
text: ourselves.
